column3: str
...<Highlight>StringParameter(1)</Highlight>, was it? If that is your desire, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>, then it shall be done.

Retire <Highlight>StringParameter(1)</Highlight>?
※Retired chocobos cannot be re-registered as race chocobos.
Yes
No
I see you are resolved. Very well. What parting words have you for your chocobo?
Praising a chocobo's acquired ability will transform it into a hereditary ability, which can be passed down through generations.
What will you say?
That'll do, chocobo. That'll do.
Fare thee well, old friend. I'll never forget you─nor your mastery of <Sheet(ChocoboRaceAbility,IntegerParameter(1),0)/>, and how it carried us to victory!
No, not yet! I am not ready to say good-bye!
...Your chocobo shall enjoy a life of luxury─of that you can be assured.
As a reminder, take care not to misplace your retired chocobo registration form.
Should you wish to arrange a covering, you will need to present it to Katering at Moogle's Gift Mounts.
Very well. You needn't concern yourself with this one any longer.
Begging your pardons, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>, but your hands seem rather full at the moment. Mayhap you should see to your possessions before discussing this matter with me.
You cannot retire a chocobo without space in your inventory to store the retired chocobo registration form.
If that is your desire, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>, then it shall be done.
How odd. You did say you wished to retire a chocobo, did you not? Yet according to my records, you do not have a race chocobo registered.
Only a registered race chocobo with a rank of 40 or higher can be retired.
